reviewText: This is absolutely the best video of any group I have ever seen, period!  I have lent this DVD to young bands just to inspire them! This is the one video which shows Blondie at it's absolute best, and will be immortilized forever!  The Video and Audio quality is also unbelieveble for it's time. "It doesn't get any better than this"!
summary: It Doesn't Get Any Better Than This!
Title: N/A

reviewText: If your an avid Blondie fan and/or DVD collector, then chances are you already own this DVD.This is the same performance from the Beat Club (AKA. Musik Laden) that was released several years ago with a different cover and title: "The Best of the Beat Club live: Blondie"Not the their best performance on DVD but great if your looking into early Blondie in their pre-hits era.This DVD contains a few visually enternaining numbers...the music is pretty good considering Blondie weren't considered the best band live but they play it up in this one.Very dated at almost 30 years ago but the sound and picture is exellent. From January 1978 supportign their Plastic Letters album that came out the next month.So if your looking to fill your collection get it!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a great DVD of "early" Blondie. Debbie is fantastic, and so is the band. This dvd contains some of their early songs. Debbie is a fantastic performer, and this dvd proves it!!! I just wish it was longer, but anything from Blondie is great!!! The approx. run time is only about 30 minutes or so, but every minute is very good. If you like Blondie, you'll like this DVD. Thanks!!!
summary: EXCELLENT 1978 VINTAGE BLONDIE PERFORMING ON A GERMAN TV SHOW!!! (DVD)
Title: N/A

reviewText: A Molten, exhilarating look at Blondie's top-of-the mark shot at early stardom. Who would think that a German Beat club, in front of a hundred mesmerized fans, would capture a smoldering performance by future Hall of Famers, Blondie? This runs a little over 28 minutes featuring raw, thrusting, cranking punk-rock gems from the first 2 albums alone, anticipating the golden nuggets to soon follow. Tough, tight and together, future success assured. This is the "Shea Stadium"-like glance of Blondie greatness, before they got bogged down by commercialism. Success is surely in the small, smokin' details. Hot.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Do not bother to buy this DVD if you already have a DVD copy of Blondie's concert for German Radio Bremen MusikLaden Live. If you can find the original: "Blondie: the best of MusikLaden Live" 1999, EME America/Pioneer Artists. It is just a repackaging of the same concert available on several DVD releases.
summary: Yet another copy of Blondie: The Best of MusikLaden Live
Title: N/A

reviewText: Blondie was (and still is) a great band.  They took the punk sensibilities of the Ramones and put classic "girl group" sounds of the 60's on top of it, thus creating a signature sound which culminated in the worldwide hit "Heart of Glass" in 1979.  Nevertheless, this DVD is interesting to me because they were not superstars yet and still had that punk edge.  This is amust see for Blondie fans.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The presentation is very clear. The performance is excellent. Very energetic and Debra Harry performs with verve. I wish it was an hour longer!
